clinical_study.brief_title: Duration of Immobilization After Rotator Cuff Repair: Its Clinical Impact
clinical_study.official_title: Prolonged Versus Conventional Immobilization After Arthroscopic Repair for Medium to Large Size Rotator Cuff Tear. A Prospective Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether the immobilization period is helpful for the better healing of repaired rotator cuff.
The investigators hypothesis is that the longer immobilization after rotator cuff repair will help the healing of rotator cuff.

primary_outcome.measure: repair integrity analysis using postoperative MRI

secondary_outcome.measure: American Shoulder and Elbow Surgeons' score

intervention.description: compared the healing status for 8 weeks of immobilization with the conventional 4 weeks of immobilization after rotator cuff repair

study_pop.textblock: medium to large size rotator cuff tears

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Medium to large sized cuff tear (2-4 cm)
- Yes subscapular partial fraying or longitudinal split side to side
- Yes acromioplasty
- Yes AC arthritis with mumford procedure
- Yes biceps tenotomy or tenodesis
Exclusion Criteria:
- No arthritic changes of glenohumeral joint
- No combined infection
- No mini-open procedures
- No complete subscapularis tear
- No incomplete repair
- No small tears or side to side repairs without anchors
- No pregnancy
